fr.uga.pddl4j.util

Class AbstractCodedOp

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.uga.pddl4j.util.AbstractCodedOp
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CodedOp, java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BitOp

    public abstract class AbstractCodedOp
extends java.lang.Object
implements CodedOp
    This abstract class implements the common part of an operator what ever its representation, i.e., integer or bit set.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if name == null || parameters == null || instantiations == null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if parameters.length != instantiations.length.

      • setValueOfParameter

        public final void setValueOfParameter(int index,
                                      int value)
                               throws java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException,
                                      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Instantiate a parameter of the operator at a specified index with a value.

        The assumption is made that different operator parameters are instantiated with different constants, i.e., the planner never generates actions like move(a,a) because we consider this as a bad domain representation that should be revised. In fact, in operators with identical constant parameters, all but one of the constants are superfluous and can be skipped from the representation without loss of information.

        Specified by:
        setValueOfParameter in interface CodedOp
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the parameter to instantiate.
        value - the value of instantiation.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if 0 <= index < arity does not hold.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if value < 0.
